description: codified identifier for disaster - declaration type + disaster number + state
an incremented value used to designate an event
US state or territory - formatted as XX
DR("major disaster") or EM("emergency management") or FM("fire management")
date of disaster declaration formatted YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
fiscal year of declaration formatted YYYY
classification of incident type example: "Flood" "Fire" "Earthquake"] "Hurricane"
generic identifier for incident typically human readable and categorical (eg. Hurricane Katrina)
boolean value denotes if the "Individual and Households" program was declared
boolean value denotes if the "Individual Assistance program" program was declared
boolean value denotes if the "Public Assistance program" program was declared
boolean value denotes if the "Hazard Mitigation program" program was declared
date for the actual start of the incident (incidents could begin prior to disaster declaration) format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
date for the actual end of the incident format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
date that specifies the financial closeout for the given incident mostly NA format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
codification of location of the event through a concatenation of fipsStateCode and fipsCountyCode (example: 47001 is Anderson County TN v. 47037 being Davidson County TN)
internal codification of a location for FEMA - "99" + fipsCountyCode (example: 99037 is Davidson County TN 037 is the county FIPS code)
human-readable string describing the affected area could be "Statewide"
identifier specific to the request to declare an incident a disaster
date of the last Individual Assistance program filing format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
MD5 Hash of the record
unique record identifier
date of the last refresh from FEMA format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
